climbs.name: Acid Test
climbs.fa: TR Mike Todd & Mark Smedley 1978     First Ascent: On-sight free solo Charlie Fowler 1983

content.description: Start with fists and hands working up the obvious line. There are good feet the whole way up. The crack slowly withers away towards the top and last few moves are on the face. About half way up the crack, there is an outcropping of crystals to the left. You can crimp on one of those to re-situate yourself. Lay into the final finger crack and either crimp or palm your way to the top.
content.protection: This is a pretty highball boulder problem if you are going that route. A walk around on the back provides access to a firmly rooted small tree that can be used as a TR anchor. **there is no additional anchor placement... please dont pull the tree out on a big fall**
content.location: Directly behind the Sylan lake Auitorium   Look for obvious overhung boulder with beautiful crack.

content.description: The Acid Test Boulder is home to one gnarly-looking overhanging crack.  It is one of the more beautiful looking boulder problems that I have seen.  There may be possibility for other problems on this boulder, but the crack on the left side is the most obvious.  It is possible to set up a toprope either by using a tree on top or by setting up a gear anchor with large cams.
